ts_loger_one_filter.cpp Example

This usage:
  • You have one thread-safe logger
  • You have one filter, which is always turned on
  • You want to format the message before it's written
  • The logger has several log destinations
    • The output goes to console, debug output window, and a file called out.txt
    • Formatting - prefix each message by its index, thread id, and append newline

Optimizations:

  • use a cache string (from optimize namespace), in order to make formatting the message faster

In this example, all output will be written to the console, debug window, and "out.txt" file. It will look similar to:

[T5884] [1] message 0
[T7168] [2] message 0
[T7932] [3] message 0
[T740] [4] message 0
[T8124] [5] message 0
[T5884] [6] message 1
[T5884] [7] message 2
[T740] [8] message 1
[T7168] [9] message 1
[T7932] [10] message 1
[T8124] [11] message 1
[T5884] [12] message 3
[T7168] [13] message 2
[T5884] [14] message 4
[T740] [15] message 2
[T7932] [16] message 2
[T8124] [17] message 2
[T7168] [18] message 3
[T5884] [19] message 5
...
